item.description: We have a family-style dinner every Sunday through Thursday night. Come eat with us!

item.title: s Fud with Us!
item.description: Enlist with Team Wednesday and aid in their quest to feed a house full of hungry tEps.
We have a family-style dinner every Sunday through Thursday night. Come eat with us!

item.title: s Fud with Us!
item.description: Enlist with Team Tuesday and aid in their quest to feed a house full of hungry tEps.
tEp has Cocoa the night after the first classes of the week, every week of the semester! Come over for cocoa, breads, cheeses and get to know tEp!
We have a family-style dinner every Sunday through Thursday night. Come eat with us!

item.title: s Fud with Us!
item.description: Enlist with Team Monday and aid in their quest to feed a house full of hungry tEps.

item.title: The Crock
item.description: Come one, come all, to tEp’s annual Comic Rock Opera!

item.title: Iron tEps Eating Competition
item.description: Which cook wins the grand prize? You be the judge.

item.title: Iron tEps Cooking Competition
item.description: What’s for dinner? We don’t know either. Come join tEp’s culinary experts in the ultimate cooking challenge.

item.title: Brunch
item.description: Fill your stomachs, heart, and pineal glands. tEp has brunch every Sunday morning. Join us for the spiritual awakening that is getting out of bed on Sunday.

item.title: Science Smorgasbord
item.description: Prepare your minds for true enlightenment that can only be achieved through applying a strong electromagnetic field to pickles.

item.title: Espresso Crawl
item.description: How many sips does it take to get through all of the coffee shops in Boston? The world may never know.

item.title: Food Orgy
item.description: We have more food than we know what to do with and have to eat it all. One rule: you’re not allowed to feed yourself. There are few better ways to meet people than this special networking event.

item.title: Ineffective Field Theory
item.description: Many features of nature can be described in terms of fields. Come learn about electromagnetic fields, corn fields, and our noble president Gabe Fields.

item.title: Algorithmic Electronic music
item.description: Like listening to bleep bloops? Let’s generate some! They only have to be pleasant if you want them to. After this session you are guaranteed to become a world-famous techno DJ.

item.title: Break our Doorbell
item.description: The tEp doorbell can play sounds between 10 and 60 Hz. Come program it for yourself, or just find tEp’s resonant frequency.

item.title: Duct Tape Bondage
item.description: If it moves and it shouldn’t, add more duct tape. Come duct tape us to the wall.

item.title: Dr. Seuss Cocoa
item.description: One cocoa, two cocoa, red cocoa, blue cocoa! On the first day of classes of every week, tEp has a hot cocoa study break with lots of cheese and other snacks. While a cocoa’s a cocoa no matter how small, this one is particularly special. Ft. Dr. Seuss read far too dramatically

item.title: Seminar on Charcuterie and Physics
item.description: Have you ever heard of a magnon-polariton? How about sopressata? One of these is a magnetic wave and the other is an Italian cured meat. You’ll never guess which is which.

item.title: Flashmob on the T
item.description: Phase 1: Pick a thing to do in public. Phase 2: Do that thing in public, pray for attention.

item.title: Spice Cream
item.description: Have you ever had rosemary flavored ice cream? How about lemongrass? Garlic? Siracha? Join our flavor extracting experts in a quest to invent Ben and Jerry’s next famous flavor.

item.title: Picnic in the Pavillion
item.description: Join us for a picnic in the Pavilion!

item.title: Lie-off
item.description: Why settle for a half-truth, when no truth will do just fine? Get the finest bullshit from an accredited institution! MIT’s expert orators will entice your ears and defy your senses! Don’t miss the 22nd annual bullshitters’ Olympics!

item.title: tEp Talks
item.description: Us tEps have honed our skills and knowledge like the edge of a very sharp knife. Come eat donuts and listen to (occasionally) interesting lectures from the self-important weirdos of tEp!

item.title: Impromptu Amateur Jam Sess
item.description: We have a lot of instruments and you are all amazing musicans. Let’s make the next Top 40 song.

item.title: Cannoli Hunting
item.description: Join us on a trip to the North end to hunt one of Boston’s most elusive dessert species: the cannolo. Don’t forget to leave one at Paul Revere’s grave.

item.title: Milk Crate Construction
item.description: How many milk crates can we stack in the center stairwell before they fall over? Hard hats provided.

item.title: Waffle Architecture
item.description: Once upon a time, someone told you not to play with your food. Come build your masterpiece out of waffles, fresh fruit, and marshmallow fluff (and eat it too).

item.title: Lost in Boston
item.description: Boston has famously confusing intersections and pockets of weird organization within the entropy. Come explore the topology of this strange city and maybe grab dessert.

item.title: Italian Feast
item.description: The finest Italian dinner and desserts tEp has to offer at this specific time.

item.title: Derpy Robot Fighting
item.description: Watch said derpy robots battle to the death. Some of them might even move.

item.title: leached T-Shirts
item.description: Like tie-dye, but with more oxidation! Materials provided, designers wanted.

item.title: Derpy Robot Building
item.description: Have you wanted to build a robot, but worried that you wouldn’t know how? Have you wanted to make a robot out of Barbie limbs and HotWheels? Come try it out in our annual robot competition!

item.title: Brunch
item.description: tEp has brunch every Sunday morning. Come join us for what is objectively the best meal.

item.title: OOBLECK!!
item.description: Experience over 1000 pounds of non-newtonian fun. What could go wrong?

item.title: Dessert
item.description: Come sample delicacies from the five major food groups: cupcakes, regular cakes, eclairs, bon-bons, and souffles.

item.title: Henna
item.description: Cover yourself from foot to toe in mesmerising fractal patterns. Extra feet and toes will be provided.

item.title: Dumplings
item.description: Best dumplings EVER (vegan-friendly option provided).

item.title: The Gospel According to Nick Hanssens
item.description: I look back and I cannot help but think about how much I learned while living at tep. Yes, I learned to cook and to handle money and to fix things; but, at least for me, that isn’t what was important. There were the times when trying to relate to 30 people felt overwhelming and pointless; and there were the times the house was there for me when I really needed it to be.

item.title: The Gospel According to Wally Holland
item.description: quarter of two a.m.. two hours ago, pounding down the street, will and rhett at my heels, the only thought to get to the ice cream shoppe before it closes. wet ground, the occasional car. boston still alive at that time of night, but headed for bed shortly. on the stereo, u2. “still haven’t found what i’m looking for”. not exactly true, is it? something special here. got cookies and cream, size medium, and colyn insisted that we go to the supermarket afterward, silly thing really, only we’d go any damned place at that time of night, if you asked.

One of the most unique and mature aspects of MIT is the diverse range of living opportunities available to fit our student body. You have experienced but the tip of the iceberg until you taste of the great wild world that lies just ex loco parentis.

Tired of the blandness of the dorms? Want something different? tEp is a unique place where you can find a whole new level of independence from the ‘tvte.

The rules we follow at tEp are the rules we choose for ourselves. It’s a lot of responsibility to govern yourself, but hell, you’re an adult, and we’re sure you can handle it.

item.title: Contact Info
item.description: Phone Number: 617.262.5090 Address: 253 Commonwealth Avenue Boston, MA 02116 Directions: From MIT: Walk 22 minutes from MIT, or take the Saferide Boston East to the first stop (Mass Ave and Beacon St) and walk from there. Elsewhere: You’re on your own. Email: (get on our mailing list) Loading...

item.title: Tour
item.description: You’ve heard stories about tEp: a.k.a. the purple palace, the last stronghold of the knights of the lambda calculus, the U.S.S. Birthday Ship. You’ve been meaning to get over there to see what it’s all about. But, you are lazy. Instead, you went to the tEp website and opted for the virtual house tour. We understand. This site brings you to such a virtual house tour. It is a multimedia text adventure game.
